com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.conversation.v1.model

Class Intent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.conversation.v1.model.Intent

  • public class Intent
extends Object
    A class representing an Intent as detected by the service. The intent is the 'intent' of the user utterance, e.g. "pay_bill", "check_balance" etc.. The intent is accompanied by a confidence score ranging between 0.0 and 1.0, with 1.0 being the most confident.

      Instantiates a new intent.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfidence

        public Double getConfidence()
        Returns the confidence associated with the intent. When the service parses/analyzes the user input it tries to determine the 'intent' of what the user said. The service will be trained to expect n different intents and the service tries to match the input with one of the intents. The confidence is the value assigned by the system to the returned intent. High confidence scores (close to 1.0) imply that the system is very confident that the user meant the returned intent. Low confidence scores indicate that the system is not confident in its response.
        Returns:
        a float representing system confidence

      • getIntent

        public String getIntent()
        Returns the name of the intent that the system detected in the user input.
        Returns:
        a string representing an intent name

      • setConfidence

        public void setConfidence(Double confidence)
        Sets the system confidence in the intent.
        Parameters:
        confidence - a float between 0.0 and 1.0

      • setIntent

        public void setIntent(String intent)
        Sets the name of the intent the system understood the user to have 'said'.
        Parameters:
        intent - a string representing one of the trained intents
